programme.desc: Brand new series - Uncut Femmes: New episodes come to E4. It turns out that there's more to Chief Wiggum's wife than it seems. And Marge gets involved in a jewel heist.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - Burger Kings: New episodes come to E4. Mr Burns gets into the plant-based burger business. But Lisa is convinced that he has an ulterior motive.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics have been watching Line of Duty, Naked Attraction, I Can See Your Voice, Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow and BBC News (Prince Philip).

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex...
programme.desc: ...Experiment: Chelsea and George seek a threesome, but will it help Chelsea move past George's sexually adventurous past and infidelity? Jess and Ben host a naked dinner party.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Emmy-Lou from Brighton appears on the daring dating show for the third time, and forensics student Charlie strips as he seeks his ideal partner in crime.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Computer programmer Andrew has been single for 10 years. Will he click with old-fashioned romantic Sarah? And Kenny and his biceps 'James' and 'Andrew' return to the restaurant.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to Grover's Birthday: When Dave and Gemma's elaborate plans for Grover's 7th birthday party go awry, Malcolm and Marty come to the rescue.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: A Wrestler Named Goldberg: Murray coaches Barry for his first high school wrestling match but keeps it a secret from Beverly, who is sure to disapprove.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Lucas takes it upon himself to save Dillon, while Ste sets out to prove that Jez is up to no good. Arlo stirs the pot, and everything gets too much for Diane as she tries to protect Ro.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A miscommunication is made worse when Arlo stirs the pot. Ste sets out to prove that Jez is up to no good, but what will he uncover?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Everything gets too much for Diane as she does all she can to protect Ro. Elsewhere, Jez is jumpy when the police search the allotment. And can two residents be bought with flashy perks?

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Trobiano's: Gordon Ramsay meets struggling executive chef Anthony Trobiano, who's sinking under half a million dollars of debt at his restaurant in Great Neck, New York.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Kara-Te: On the eve of the annual high school talent show, Beverly and Murray fall out over Barry's plan to perform his martial arts routine on stage.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: You're Under Foot: When Beverly complains that Pops is spending too much time with her at home, Murray takes him back to work at the furniture shop.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Launch Acceleration: When NASA inform Howard that his space mission has been rescheduled to an earlier date, he tries to use the wedding as an excuse not to go.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Countdown Reflection: Bernadette decides that she wants to get married to Howard before his NASA space mission, but can they get organised in time?

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Pager, a Club and a Cranky Bag of Wrinkles: Dr Linkletter pushes Sheldon to make friends with his fellow students, and Georgie gets a pager.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Box of Treasure and the Meemaw of Science: Sheldon, Dr Linkletter and Meemaw team up on a science experiment. And Georgie has a new side hustle.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Truth Be Told: After reconnecting on Facebook, Phil invites his old high school girlfriend to drop by the house, but this friendly visit quickly turns into trouble.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Starry Night: Jay and Mitchell set out on their traditional father-son outing to see the meteor showers, but Mitchell is surprised to see that Manny will be joining them.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Game Changer: Mitchell decides to toughen up, Cameron gets involved in a neighbour's marital problems, and it's Jay against Gloria and Manny in chess.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comic-Con Conundrum: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj appoints Sheldon to organise his finances. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Escape Hatch Identification: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj when he's forced to move out of his flat, leading to unexpected conflict.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Collaboration Fluctuation: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, and Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's professional life.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Potential Energy and Hooch on a Park Bench: Sheldon tries to convince Dr Sturgis to return to the university. And Georgie upsets the family.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Pish Posh and a Secret Back Room: Meemaw opens a secret gambling room, and Sheldon, Missy and Georgie adapt to new living arrangements.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Snapped: Claire needs to clear the house before anyone makes her look bad in front of a reporter from an important women's business magazine. Jay invites Manny to a wine tasting.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Perfect Pairs: Phil, Claire, Alex and Luke love looking after the twins, but find it exhausting. But then they realise that the babies might be useful for their to-do lists...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Old Yeller Belly: Santa's Little Helper becomes Duff Beer's new mascot after he's banished from the Simpson home for failing to save Homer from a tree house fire.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brake My Wife, Please: When Homer is banned from driving, Marge gets stressed ferrying everyone around, but Homer enjoys walking everywhere - until Marge crashes into him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tesla Recoil: Leonard and Howard learn that Sheldon went to work with the military behind their backs. Bernadette thinks Ruchi's trying to steal her job.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bitcoin Entanglement: Sheldon seeks revenge when the guys cut him out of a potentially valuable investment. A secret about Leonard and Penny is revealed.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Confidence Erosion: Sheldon and Amy try to use maths to make their wedding planning less stressful. Raj falls out with Howard.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Homer They Fall: Homer becomes a boxer, thanks to his abnormally hard head. But is his skull strong enough for a fight against heavyweight champion Drederick Tatum?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: While Tony cooks a family dinner at The Hutch, Arlo stirs trouble. Elsewhere, a resident finds comfort in an ex, and a son disapproves of his dad's new relationship.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight
programme.desc: Australia: Brand new series: Will a concerned cousin hamper Morena and Tony's European wedding? And an unexpected first dance could change everything!

programme.title: New: Love Triangle UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: More love-hunting singles date two suitors in the explosive dating show. Our first hopefuls decide who to move in with - based purely on textual chemistry.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Can Jayden hide his Don Juan ways from Isabel? Will estate agent John give Sarah, who's deaf, the butterflies in the stomach she's hoping for?

programme.title: The Infernal Machine
programme.desc: (2022) Thriller starring Guy Pearce as a writer-in-hiding whose novel inspired a teenager to kill 13 people 25 years ago. And now he must revisit the past.

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: (1997) Sci-fi horror with Laurence Fishburne. A top-secret spaceship re-appears, crewless, after being lost for seven years. And it really takes against those who are sent to investigate...

programme.title: After Blue
programme.desc: (2021) Sci-fi fantasy set on a women-only planet. After releasing outlaw Kate Bush - not the singer - from captivity, Roxy is ordered to hunt her down or face death. In French/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Ferdinand
programme.desc: (2017) Charming animated bovine road movie from the makers of Ice Age. A huge but gentle bull (voiced by John Cena) tries to get home after being sent away to a bull fighting ranch.

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: (2009) Martial arts adventure. Justin Chatwin stars as the leader of a mystical band of warriors who are out to save the world from the ancient demon Lord Piccolo. With James Marsters.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: (1995) It's got Alicia Silverstone and Brittany Murphy. Director Amy Heckerling based it on an idea by Jane Austen. What better 90s high-school comedy to watch on International Women's Day?

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham
programme.desc: (2002) Gurinder Chadha's feel-good British comedy is now the highest grossing football film of all time. Watch Parminder Nagra and Keira Knightley go for goal on International Women's Day.

programme.title: Belle
programme.desc: (2014) Amma Asante's powerful fact-based drama about Britain's first Black aristocrat. Watch Gugu Mbatha-Raw portray the extraordinary Dido Belle on International Women's Day.

programme.title: Queenpins
programme.desc: (2021) On International Women's Day, Kristen Bell and Kirby Howell-Baptiste conjure criminal hi-jinks from the apparently banal in Gita Pullapilly and Aron Gaudet's fact-based comic caper.

programme.title: Hustlers
programme.desc: (2019) Lorene Scafaria's fact-based caper. Jennifer Lopez leads a group of high-end strippers who turn the tables on sleazy blokes and stick it to the Man on International Women's Day.

programme.title: A Banquet
programme.desc: (2021) A screening of Ruth Paxton's thought-provoking body-horror on International Women's Day. Could a teenager who stops eating but stays the same weight be a mythical Japanese monster?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Shrek Forever After
programme.desc: (2010) Animated adventure. In the ogre's fourth feature-length escapade, Shrek makes an unwise bargain with Rumpelstiltskin. With the voices of Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz and Eddie Murphy.

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: (2011) Family comedy. Jim Carrey stars as a work-obsessed New York property developer whose life is turned upside down when he receives a crate containing six live penguins.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: (1995) Swashbuckling adventure. Geena Davis and Matthew Modine star as pirates racing to find the missing parts of their treasure map and beat an evil rival (Frank Langella) to the booty.

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2
programme.desc: (2017) Comedy sequel with Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson and John Lithgow. There's trouble in store for the extended family when Dusty and Brad's fathers visit for Christmas.

programme.title: The Last Duel
programme.desc: (2021) Historical drama from director Ridley Scott. Trial by combat is the only option to save a noblewoman's honour. With Jodie Comer, Matt Damon, Adam Driver and Ben Affleck.

programme.title: Blue Bayou
programme.desc: (2021) Justin Chon's poignant drama about a man of Korean descent who is threatened with deportation from the US even though he was adopted into an American family when he was three.

programme.title: The Gravedigger's Wife
programme.desc: (2021) Evocative drama following the struggles of a family in Djibouti. A gravedigger must find the funds to pay for his wife's life-saving surgery. In Somali/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Step Up: Ready to Drive
programme.desc: Sisters Mandy and Coco share a passion for cooking. They bought a caravan during lockdown with the dream of launching a food business. But after three years, the project remains incomplete.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Outcast of the Islands
programme.desc: (1951) Director Carol Reed's drama. A disgraced trader finds a new life in a secretive trading village. However, his own greed soon brings trouble. With Trevor Howard and Ralph Richardson.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: (1956) Western with Glenn Ford, Ernest Borgnine, Rod Steiger and Valerie French. A cowboy is given a job by a rancher, sparking lethal jealousy in a colleague and desire in the boss's wife.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: The Desert Rats
programme.desc: (1953) Second World War drama featuring Richard Burton as the commander of Australian troops during the 1941 siege of Tobruk. Also starring Robert Newton and James Mason.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: (1984) Musical drama with Kevin Bacon. An unruly teen moves to a small town where dancing is banned. As more teens start misbehaving, can he change his elders' minds? Violence.

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: (2014) Action-comedy with Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson. A London teenager is introduced a secret society of immaculately dressed agents that exists to save the world.

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: (1992) Thriller with Harrison Ford and Sean Bean. An ex-CIA agent foils an IRA assassination plot. But a vengeful IRA man follows him back to America.

programme.desc: (2022) Thriller starring Guy Pearce as a writer-in-hiding whose novel inspired a teenager to kill 13 people 25 years ago. And now he must revisit the past.

programme.title: The Brit Awards 2025
programme.desc: Comedian Jack Whitehall returns to host the ceremony for a fifth time, from London's O2 Arena, as the people of the music industry gather to celebrate another 12 months in pop. Those taking to the stage include Sabrina Carpenter, Jade, Myles Smith, the Last Dinner Party, Teddy Swims and Shaboozey

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: LIV Golf Live
programme.desc: Coverage of day two of the tournament from Hong Kong Golf Club at Fanling. Abraham Ancer of Mexico was victorious here last year

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Fred's cycle on the North Coast takes him through dramatic cliffs and rolling hills. He tries golf and also gets a lesson in hurling, the fastest field sport in the world.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is in Birmingham with the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The presenter visits the Greek island of Kefalonia, a place known for its pies. Judi visits a family run restaurant, where Mirela makes the famous kreatopita pie for her, gets crafty with a Kefalonian tradition, and meets Kostas at his vineyard. She also makes a spinach, feta and walnut parcel with a tomato salad

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Philip Glenister, Jenny Agutter and Renee Bailey join Alan in the barn and Dr Bolu Eso meets some famous dog breeds. Jamie Butterworth plants some early spring shrubbery and Becky Paskin makes some Old Hollywood cocktails

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers, while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin and Jonathan Phang

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: On the menu this time are a zesty oxtail and shin curry, some spiced marinated barbecue prawns, and a tahini banana bread and butter pudding with its own candied bacon and pecan bourbon ice cream, before Nisha has a family recipe tasting in the evening

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The next leg of James's trip sees him heading to Bresse, home of one of the country's most famous ingredients - the Bresse chicken. He visits a poultry farm to discover just why these birds are so special, and gets the chance to cook his own. Moving on, he meets Georges Blanc, owner of a three-Michelin-starred restaurant - and one of James's culinary heroes

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v France (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland are the only team still undefeated in this year's competition, and prevailed 38-17 when these teams met in Paris last year. However, they can take nothing for granted against the French, who lost by one point away to England in round two, but bounced back with a stunning 73-24 triumph in Italy, a match that broke the Six Nations record for tries in a single game with 14. With analysis from Rory Best and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Brian O'Driscoll, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Ben Kay and Gordon D'Arcy

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Adam Jones, Monica Dolan, Dom Wood and Dick McCourt pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show, which sees events assistant Alex, weight loss coach Jennifer and business owner Chris spin the wheel and try to solve the word puzzles in a bid to win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of 50,000

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: A new set of acts aim to book their places in the semi-finals, with judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and KSI deciding which ones will go through, under the watchful eye of Ant and Dec

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host talks to Warwick Davis, former Doctor Who and Broadchurch star Jodie Whittaker, comedian, writer and actor Daisy May Cooper, and Top Boy actor and rapper Ashley Walters. Former BRIT Award-nominated rock band Nova Twins perform in the studio

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Murder of Grace Millane: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Documentary examining the role social media played in the death of British backpacker Grace Millane, who went missing while on a Tinder date in New Zealand in 2018. Featuring interviews with people who knew her or were involved with the investigation, with revealing police interview footage and CCTV

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Burnley v Luton Town at Turf Moor, Derby County v Blackburn Rovers at Pride Park and Sheffield United v Preston North End at Bramall Lane in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: The teams are challenged by Gordon to create a poultry dish, but one contestant is sent home with their dreams up in flames.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Sunderland for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: A new set of acts aim to book their places in the semi-finals, with judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and KSI deciding which ones will go through, under the watchful eye of Ant and Dec

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers, while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin and Jonathan Phang

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined on the farm by comedy couple Paul Merton and Suki Webster, along with presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle. Jonathan Moseley shows off some sustainable spring floristry and Tom Surgey brings a delicious selection of cheese and wine pairings to the barn in the Best of British feature

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Portsmouth v Leeds United (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents all the action from the Championship match at Fratton Park. Leeds are among the favourites to win the title, but they drew 3-3 when they met Pompey at Fratton Park in August. Callum Lang's penalty looked to have won it for Portsmouth in the second minute of stoppage time, but Brenden Aaronson was still able to rescue a point for United. With analysis from Stuart Dallas and Matt Taylor, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward, and reports from Aaron Paul

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the final match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. England have bounced back from a loss away to Ireland in the opening round with single-point victories over both France and Scotland. They will be expecting a more comfortable victory against the Italians, who were thrashed 73-24 at home to France last time out, but the Azzurri's 22-15 win against Wales in round two shows they can be a threat on their day. With analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Maggie Alphonsi and Sergio Parisse, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Kyle Sinckler, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern present the grand finale, as the final three couples go head to head in a bid to lift the Dancing on Ice Trophy. Their routines include a dazzling showcase choreographed by Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, who will also skate together on television for the final time ahead of their farewell tour, marking the end of an era for the duo. Ashley Banjo and Oti Mabuse complete the judging line up

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Hosted by Jeremy Clarkson

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A vital clue leads the MIU to take a closer look at another of Hannah's family members, but when red tape stops the team in their tracks, Manning's frustrations at the lack of results reach an all-time high and he cuts corners to move the investigation forward. Elsewhere, Jenn's FLO relationship is in peril when her support for Steve goes too far, Chris faces the Ofsted inspectors, and Manning is left in hot water by another dead end

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Action crime thriller starring Tom Cruise. When five innocent people are gunned down in Pittsburgh, all evidence points to former US Army sniper James Barr. However, Barr refuses to confess to the crime, and sends out word for ex-military investigator Jack Reacher to clear his name. Despite being no friend of Barr's, Reacher looks into the murders and discovers the victims may not have been so randomly selected after all.

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The final stage of Fred Sirieix's gastronomic tour takes him to Derry during the Halloween festival where he dances his way through the parade and explores the arboretum and BBQ school at Brook Hall. He also tackles a cycling challenge to the village of Muff in nearby County Donegal and meets Mickey Bradley from the Undertones

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: On the menu this time are a zesty oxtail and shin curry, some spiced marinated barbecue prawns, and a tahini banana bread and butter pudding with its own candied bacon and pecan bourbon ice cream, before Nisha has a family recipe tasting in the evening

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan and a team of experts examine the latest horticultural trends for seasoned and aspiring gardeners alike. Alan showcases his early-blooming plants, Camilla Bassett-Smith visits the world's largest indoor rainforest to meet the team behind it, Claire Lowrie leads a houseplant masterclass for beginners, Anna Greenland answers a viewer's query on growing vegetables, and Errol Reuben Fernandes explores an inner-city community garden

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. Playing today are partners Darren and Emma, father and daughter Neil and Bex, and engaged couple Norah and Dom

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Susan from Stoke-on-Trent, Jamahl from Birmingham, Ali from Corwen and Spencer from Kent pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon acts dishonestly, Steph's suspicions pique, and Sarah gets sad news

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Accusations fly in the aftermath of the crash, Betsy refuses to curtail her freedom because of Rob, Eileen catches Julie whispering with George, and Alya bids an emotional farewell to Yasmeen

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A new SIO is called in to lead the MIU team, who struggle to adapt to a new way of working, but are forced to accept the new regime to get fresh leads in Hannah's case. Meanwhile, Jenn must choose between her family and her job when an error in judgement gets Erin in hot water at work, and Julie's trust in Jenn is damaged when Craig is arrested

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: LIV Golf Live
programme.desc: Coverage of day three of the tournament from Hong Kong Golf Club at Fanling. Abraham Ancer of Mexico was victorious here last year

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Sunderland for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: A new set of acts aim to book their places in the semi-finals, with judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and KSI deciding which ones will go through, under the watchful eye of Ant and Dec

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers, while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin and Jonathan Phang

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined on the farm by comedy couple Paul Merton and Suki Webster, along with presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle. Jonathan Moseley shows off some sustainable spring floristry and Tom Surgey brings a delicious selection of cheese and wine pairings to the barn in the Best of British feature

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Portsmouth v Leeds United (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents all the action from the Championship match at Fratton Park. Leeds are among the favourites to win the title, but they drew 3-3 when they met Pompey at Fratton Park in August. Callum Lang's penalty looked to have won it for Portsmouth in the second minute of stoppage time, but Brenden Aaronson was still able to rescue a point for United. With analysis from Stuart Dallas and Matt Taylor, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward, and reports from Aaron Paul

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the final match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. England have bounced back from a loss away to Ireland in the opening round with single-point victories over both France and Scotland. They will be expecting a more comfortable victory against the Italians, who were thrashed 73-24 at home to France last time out, but the Azzurri's 22-15 win against Wales in round two shows they can be a threat on their day. With analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Maggie Alphonsi and Sergio Parisse, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Kyle Sinckler, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern present the grand finale, as the final three couples go head to head in a bid to lift the Dancing on Ice Trophy. Their routines include a dazzling showcase choreographed by Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, who will also skate together on television for the final time ahead of their farewell tour, marking the end of an era for the duo. Ashley Banjo and Oti Mabuse complete the judging line up

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Hosted by Jeremy Clarkson

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A vital clue leads the MIU to take a closer look at another of Hannah's family members, but when red tape stops the team in their tracks, Manning's frustrations at the lack of results reach an all-time high and he cuts corners to move the investigation forward. Elsewhere, Jenn's FLO relationship is in peril when her support for Steve goes too far, Chris faces the Ofsted inspectors, and Manning is left in hot water by another dead end

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Action crime thriller starring Tom Cruise. When five innocent people are gunned down in Pittsburgh, all evidence points to former US Army sniper James Barr. However, Barr refuses to confess to the crime, and sends out word for ex-military investigator Jack Reacher to clear his name. Despite being no friend of Barr's, Reacher looks into the murders and discovers the victims may not have been so randomly selected after all.

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The final stage of Fred Sirieix's gastronomic tour takes him to Derry during the Halloween festival where he dances his way through the parade and explores the arboretum and BBQ school at Brook Hall. He also tackles a cycling challenge to the village of Muff in nearby County Donegal and meets Mickey Bradley from the Undertones

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: On the menu this time are a zesty oxtail and shin curry, some spiced marinated barbecue prawns, and a tahini banana bread and butter pudding with its own candied bacon and pecan bourbon ice cream, before Nisha has a family recipe tasting in the evening

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan and a team of experts examine the latest horticultural trends for seasoned and aspiring gardeners alike. Alan showcases his early-blooming plants, Camilla Bassett-Smith visits the world's largest indoor rainforest to meet the team behind it, Claire Lowrie leads a houseplant masterclass for beginners, Anna Greenland answers a viewer's query on growing vegetables, and Errol Reuben Fernandes explores an inner-city community garden

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. Playing today are partners Darren and Emma, father and daughter Neil and Bex, and engaged couple Norah and Dom

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Susan from Stoke-on-Trent, Jamahl from Birmingham, Ali from Corwen and Spencer from Kent pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon acts dishonestly, Steph's suspicions pique, and Sarah gets sad news

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Accusations fly in the aftermath of the crash, Betsy refuses to curtail her freedom because of Rob, Eileen catches Julie whispering with George, and Alya bids an emotional farewell to Yasmeen

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A new SIO is called in to lead the MIU team, who struggle to adapt to a new way of working, but are forced to accept the new regime to get fresh leads in Hannah's case. Meanwhile, Jenn must choose between her family and her job when an error in judgement gets Erin in hot water at work, and Julie's trust in Jenn is damaged when Craig is arrested

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The Brit Awards 2025
programme.desc: Comedian Jack Whitehall returns to host the ceremony for a fifth time, from London's O2 Arena, as the people of the music industry gather to celebrate another 12 months in pop. programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is in Birmingham with the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The presenter visits the Greek island of Kefalonia, a place known for its pies. programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers, while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin and Jonathan Phang

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: On the menu this time are a zesty oxtail and shin curry, some spiced marinated barbecue prawns, and a tahini banana bread and butter pudding with its own candied bacon and pecan bourbon ice cream, before Nisha has a family recipe tasting in the evening

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The next leg of James's trip sees him heading to Bresse, home of one of the country's most famous ingredients - the Bresse chicken. He visits a poultry farm to discover just why these birds are so special, and gets the chance to cook his own. Moving on, he meets Georges Blanc, owner of a three-Michelin-starred restaurant - and one of James's culinary heroes

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v France (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland are the only team still undefeated in this year's competition, and prevailed 38-17 when these teams met in Paris last year. However, they can take nothing for granted against the French, who lost by one point away to England in round two, but bounced back with a stunning 73-24 triumph in Italy, a match that broke the Six Nations record for tries in a single game with 14. With analysis from Rory Best and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Brian O'Driscoll, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Ben Kay and Gordon D'Arcy

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show, which sees events assistant Alex, weight loss coach Jennifer and business owner Chris spin the wheel and try to solve the word puzzles in a bid to win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of 50,000

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: A new set of acts aim to book their places in the semi-finals, with judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and KSI deciding which ones will go through, under the watchful eye of Ant and Dec

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.desc: The host talks to Warwick Davis, former Doctor Who and Broadchurch star Jodie Whittaker, comedian, writer and actor Daisy May Cooper, and Top Boy actor and rapper Ashley Walters. Former BRIT Award-nominated rock band Nova Twins perform in the studio

programme.desc: Documentary examining the role social media played in the death of British backpacker Grace Millane, who went missing while on a Tinder date in New Zealand in 2018. programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Sunderland for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: A new set of acts aim to book their places in the semi-finals, with judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and KSI deciding which ones will go through, under the watchful eye of Ant and Dec

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers, while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin and Jonathan Phang

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined on the farm by comedy couple Paul Merton and Suki Webster, along with presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle. Jonathan Moseley shows off some sustainable spring floristry and Tom Surgey brings a delicious selection of cheese and wine pairings to the barn in the Best of British feature

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Portsmouth v Leeds United (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents all the action from the Championship match at Fratton Park. Leeds are among the favourites to win the title, but they drew 3-3 when they met Pompey at Fratton Park in August. Callum Lang's penalty looked to have won it for Portsmouth in the second minute of stoppage time, but Brenden Aaronson was still able to rescue a point for United. With analysis from Stuart Dallas and Matt Taylor, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward, and reports from Aaron Paul

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the final match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. England have bounced back from a loss away to Ireland in the opening round with single-point victories over both France and Scotland. They will be expecting a more comfortable victory against the Italians, who were thrashed 73-24 at home to France last time out, but the Azzurri's 22-15 win against Wales in round two shows they can be a threat on their day. With analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Maggie Alphonsi and Sergio Parisse, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Kyle Sinckler, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern present the grand finale, as the final three couples go head to head in a bid to lift the Dancing on Ice Trophy. Their routines include a dazzling showcase choreographed by Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, who will also skate together on television for the final time ahead of their farewell tour, marking the end of an era for the duo. Ashley Banjo and Oti Mabuse complete the judging line up

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Hosted by Jeremy Clarkson

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A vital clue leads the MIU to take a closer look at another of Hannah's family members, but when red tape stops the team in their tracks, Manning's frustrations at the lack of results reach an all-time high and he cuts corners to move the investigation forward. Elsewhere, Jenn's FLO relationship is in peril when her support for Steve goes too far, Chris faces the Ofsted inspectors, and Manning is left in hot water by another dead end

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Action crime thriller starring Tom Cruise. When five innocent people are gunned down in Pittsburgh, all evidence points to former US Army sniper James Barr. However, Barr refuses to confess to the crime, and sends out word for ex-military investigator Jack Reacher to clear his name. Despite being no friend of Barr's, Reacher looks into the murders and discovers the victims may not have been so randomly selected after all.

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The final stage of Fred Sirieix's gastronomic tour takes him to Derry during the Halloween festival where he dances his way through the parade and explores the arboretum and BBQ school at Brook Hall. He also tackles a cycling challenge to the village of Muff in nearby County Donegal and meets Mickey Bradley from the Undertones

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: On the menu this time are a zesty oxtail and shin curry, some spiced marinated barbecue prawns, and a tahini banana bread and butter pudding with its own candied bacon and pecan bourbon ice cream, before Nisha has a family recipe tasting in the evening

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan and a team of experts examine the latest horticultural trends for seasoned and aspiring gardeners alike. Alan showcases his early-blooming plants, Camilla Bassett-Smith visits the world's largest indoor rainforest to meet the team behind it, Claire Lowrie leads a houseplant masterclass for beginners, Anna Greenland answers a viewer's query on growing vegetables, and Errol Reuben Fernandes explores an inner-city community garden

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. Playing today are partners Darren and Emma, father and daughter Neil and Bex, and engaged couple Norah and Dom

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Susan from Stoke-on-Trent, Jamahl from Birmingham, Ali from Corwen and Spencer from Kent pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon acts dishonestly, Steph's suspicions pique, and Sarah gets sad news

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Accusations fly in the aftermath of the crash, Betsy refuses to curtail her freedom because of Rob, Eileen catches Julie whispering with George, and Alya bids an emotional farewell to Yasmeen

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A new SIO is called in to lead the MIU team, who struggle to adapt to a new way of working, but are forced to accept the new regime to get fresh leads in Hannah's case. Meanwhile, Jenn must choose between her family and her job when an error in judgement gets Erin in hot water at work, and Julie's trust in Jenn is damaged when Craig is arrested
